result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Court reporter Tara Monthie. Defendant Ivan I Smart in court, in custody.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Ivan I Smart.  Attorney Carl Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. In court today for a competency hearing. Parties agree with the findings in the report. Mr. Smart also agrees with the report. Court makes findings and finds the DE not competent and will issue an order for commitment. This case is suspended pending restoration of competency.
Competency hearing on September 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Court reporter Teri Groves. . Defendant Ivan I Smart in court, in custody.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Ivan I Smart.  Attorney John D Rice in court for State of Wisconsin. In court today for a competency hearing as requested by Atty Vera. Court orders a competency exam.
Competency hearing on September 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

for Competency Evaluation - filed by Atty Vera
Competency hearing on August 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 17

Defendant Ivan I Smart in court, in custody.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Ivan I Smart.  Attorney Rebekah Rennicke for John D Rice in court for State of Wisconsin. Det duly sworn and testified. Venue established. DE identified. Cross. State moves for b/o, waives argument for rebuttal. DE objects to b/o, argument.  Court finds PC felony was probably committed by DE and binds case over.

Preliminary hearing on August 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with JW. 
- Defendant shall not be in the State Street and Langdon area as indicated on attached map. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

03:12 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Diana Maria Van Rybroek.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
